data.text: @DawsonJed James, the whole point is it’s long been debunked it matters so I was showing how odd it was that poster was still up given it’s been suspended by more useful advice on how to stop Covid.

@jhallwood Perhaps, WHO still advises it as it lingers on surfaces so disinfection is important. Importantly though I am caught in a mood today hearing my daughter coughing as I type not to look back on the Pandemic lightheartedly - but I know that that day is coming, hopefully quite soon

@DawsonJed I think you’re missing the point.. distance, masks and crucially ventilation make a difference, washing hands doesn’t. We’ve known this for ages that was what I meant about it being early advice.
@jhallwood Though vaccination is working and it's our way out I still think that basic hygiene advice is still useful
@DawsonJed Washing hands doesn’t prevent Covid and we’ve known that for sometime, that’s the point..
@jhallwood It persists for good reason, believe me, someone that had to take his daughter for a PCR test today
@jhallwood Def one to keep! We need reminders.
@jhallwood Inexplicably, they were showing this very advice on the departure boards of Waverley Station just the other day.
@jhallwood Gonna see these relics for some time. Grubby 2m floor markings, empty sanistiser dispensers, face mask signs on the tube
